## Discussion

You can use this property to track the original name of the file from which you import an asset resource even if you use the [doc://com.apple.photokit/documentation/Photos/PHAssetCreationRequest/addResource(with:data:options:)] method to create a resource from data instead of from a file. After creating the asset, this information is available in the [doc://com.apple.photokit/documentation/Photos/PHAssetResource/originalFilename] property of the corresponding [doc://com.apple.photokit/documentation/Photos/PHAssetResource] object.

If you do not specify a value for this property and are using the [doc://com.apple.photokit/documentation/Photos/PHAssetCreationRequest/addResource(with:fileURL:options:)] method to create a resource, Photos infers the filename from that method’s `fileURL` parameter. # originalFilename

**Instance Property**

The filename for the asset resource being created.

## Declaration

```swift
var originalFilename: String? { get set }
```

## Discussion

You can use this property to track the original name of the file from which you import an asset resource even if you use the [doc://com.apple.photokit/documentation/Photos/PHAssetCreationRequest/addResource(with:data:options:)] method to create a resource from data instead of from a file. After creating the asset, this information is available in the [doc://com.apple.photokit/documentation/Photos/PHAssetResource/originalFilename] property of the corresponding [doc://com.apple.photokit/documentation/Photos/PHAssetResource] object.

If you do not specify a value for this property and are using the [doc://com.apple.photokit/documentation/Photos/PHAssetCreationRequest/addResource(with:fileURL:options:)] method to create a resource, Photos infers the filename from that method’s `fileURL` parameter. Otherwise, Photos automatically generates a filename.

## Describing a New Asset Resource

- **uniformTypeIdentifier**: The uniform type identifier for the resource.
- **contentType**: The type of data being provided for this asset resource. If not specified, one will be inferred from the PHAssetResourceType or file URL extension (if provided).
